body_html:
It is not a problem with python3.
You have this error because the batch size of your input is not defined (it is None), and it is referred to in the reshape operation: pool_outputs.append(tf.reshape(pool, [shape[0], -1])).
You can fix it in multiple ways: for example, rather than keeping -1 to find out the hidden size, you can infer the batch size instead and run pool_outputs.append(tf.reshape(pool, [-1, l * l * shape(3)])). Another way is to just use tf.shape(input_)[0], which is a tensor.

It is not a problem with python3.
You have this error because the batch size of your input is not defined (it is None), and it is referred to in the reshape operation: pool_outputs.append(tf.reshape(pool, [shape[0], -1])).
You can fix it in multiple ways: for example, rather than keeping -1 to find out the hidden size, you can infer the batch size instead and run pool_outputs.append(tf.reshape(pool, [-1, l * l * shape(3)])). Another way is to just use tf.shape(input_)[0], which is a tensor.
body:
It is not a problem with python3. 
You have this error because the batch size of your input is not defined (it is None), and it is referred to in the reshape operation: `pool_outputs.append(tf.reshape(pool, [shape[0], -1]))`.
You can fix it in multiple ways: for example, rather than keeping `-1` to find out the hidden size, you can infer the batch size instead and run `pool_outputs.append(tf.reshape(pool, [-1, l * l * shape(3)]))`. Another way is to just use `tf.shape(input_)[0]`, which is a tensor.
